alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 9:35AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Above Abiquiu affecting Rio Arriba County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...Rio Chama above Abiquiu. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 10.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then rise to 10.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will fall to 10.3 feet early Saturday morning. It will then rise to 10.4 feet Saturday morning. It will fall to 10.3 feet Sunday morning then rise again. - Action stage is 10.2 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1000 PM MDT.
